PRINCIPLE.Definition: a basic idea or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works

AWKWARD.Definition: difficult to use, do, or deal with

ENCOUNTER.Definition: a meeting, especially one that happens by chance

CHANGE.Definition: the money that is returned to someone who has paid for something that costs less than the amount that they gave

CONVENIENCE.Definition: anything that is easy to use and makes life comfortable

SELLING POINT.Definition: a characteristic of a product that will persuade people to buy it

CONSTRAINTS.Definition: something that controls what you do by keeping you within particular limits

PROFITABLE.Definition: making or likely to make a profit, (of a business) having larger revenues than costs

COMMISSION.Definition: a payment to someone who sells goods that is directly related to the amount sold, or a system that uses such payments

WIN-WIN.Definition: A win-win situation or result is one that is good for everyone who is involved

GLUTEN-FREE.Definition: a protein that is contained in wheat and some other grains

SCRUTINY.Definition: the careful and detailed examination of something in order to get information about it

MARGINS.Definition: the profit made on a product or service

SUSTAINABLE.Definition: able to continue over a period of time

ENTICE.Definition: to persuade someone to do something by offering them something pleasant

VIABLE.Definition: able to be done or likely to succeed

DINE-IN.Definition: eating inside a restaurant, as opposed to take-away

RELIANT.Definition: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone

INCENTIVES.Definition: something that encourages a person to do something

BUSINESS MODEL.Definition: a description of the different parts of a business or organisation showing how they will work together successfully to make money

INTENSE.Definition: extreme and forceful or (of a feeling) very strong

RACE TO THE BOTTOM.Definition: a situation in which companies compete with each other to reduce costs by paying the lowest wages or giving workers the worst conditions

SQUEEZED.Definition: to press something firmly, especially from all sides in order to change its shape, reduce its size, or remove liquid from it

FEASIBLE.Definition: able to be made, done, or achieved

FIXED COSTS.Definition: a cost such as wages, rent, and interest that does not change in relation to how much a business produces

TRAILER.Definition: a box on wheels that is pulled by a car and is used for taking things from one place to another

BOOMING.Definition: experiencing a period of fast growth

BYPASS.Definition: to avoid something by going around it

THANKLESS.Definition: A thankless job is difficult or unpleasant, and people do not thank you for it

UNPREDICTABLE.Definition: likely to change suddenly and without reason and therefore not able to be predicted (= expected before it happens) or depended on

MINIMUM WAGE.Definition: the smallest amount of money that employers are legally allowed to pay someone who works for them

GET RID OF.Definition: to sack or dismiss, to terminate a contract

SICK PAY.Definition: money given by an employer to someone who cannot work because of illness
